title: The Affordable Jewelry Brand Editors Love to Gatekeep Is Having a Huge Prime Day Sale
description: Our favorite everyday pieces are up to 25 percent off.
excerpt: Ana Luisa jewelry is on sale for Amazon Prime Big Deal Days, which ends tonight at midnight. Here, shop the discounted finds ELLE editors are wearing and gifting.
text: The Modern Statement PieceAna Luisa Pebble Pendant Necklace“Among all the jewelry I have in my collection, there’s only a small handful of statement necklaces that go with everything, so I’m adding this ultra-chic, classic pendant to my cart,” says Dale Arden Chong, senior fashion commerce editor. “It’s beautiful on its own but would look great stacked with my daintier pieces as well. Need I say more?”The Everyday HoopAna Luisa Paris Twisted Hoop Earrings“I’m a hoops girl and wear my earrings 24/7, so my everyday pair needs to be comfortable enough to sleep in and versatile enough to go with everything. These twisted huggies tick every box,” says Elly Leavitt, fashion and luxury editor. “Not only are they a great basic, but they haven’t yet tarnished even after I spent all summer swimming in them.”Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowThe Ultra-Feminine HoopsAna Luisa Jessica Puffed Heart HoopsThese puffy, heart-shaped hoops are personally my most complimented pair of earrings. They’re lightweight for easy stacking yet also fun to sport alone. I love mixing and matching them with my other heart-shaped Ana Luisa pieces, too.Mixed Metals Made EasyAna Luisa Asher Two-Tone Hoop Earrings“Because I gravitate toward minimalist jewelry, I’ve been trying to experiment with mixing metals to zhuzh up pared-back fall outfits. Much to my delight, these hoops take all the guesswork out of this effort,” says Jaimie Potters, fashion and luxury senior commerce manager. Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowThe Easiest Gift EverAna Luisa High Shine Layered Necklace Set“Ana Luisa styles, like these layered necklaces, are perfect for everyday wear because they don’t tarnish—and since they’re on the affordable side, you won’t be afraid to really live in them,” says Jane Mafale, senior content strategy manager. “Their durability and versatility make them great for gifting, too.”The Layered Hoop LookAna Luisa Toda Double Hoop EarringsThese layered hoops offer the look of multiple piercings with just one stud. Plus, they boast the perfect hint of sparkle. Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowThe Personality PieceAna Luisa Isla Heart Ring“I’ve given Ana Luisa’s jewelry as a gift so many times,” says Heath Owens, senior commerce editor at Hearst. “It’s beautiful, affordable and water-resistant, and the designs are just trendy enough that you can find something to match your giftee’s personality, like these celestial hoops or this bubble heart ring.”A Luxe Stacking RingAna Luisa Gold Eternity RingThis sparkly stacking ring may just be the most versatile piece in my growing collection of Ana Luisa jewelry. The extra thick, 14k gold plating and glittering cubic zirconia stones have held up incredibly well to regular wear and hand-washing. People are always amazed to learn how affordable this piece is despite how expensive it looks. Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowA Tasteful 2-in-1Ana Luisa Ash Double Hoop EarringsOffered in gold, silver, and mixed metals, Ana Luisa’s Ash Double Hoops are truly the gift that keeps on giving (especially when the gift recipient is yourself). The secondary twisted hoop can be removed, allowing the sleek upper hoop to be worn independently. The Do-It-All BangleAna Luisa Brynley Gold Bangle BraceletTrust me, this humble gold bangle will get a whole lot of wrist time. I love mixing one or two in with my watches and chunky chain bracelets. Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowStackable SparklesAna Luisa Eden Huggies“I’m always looking to elevate my ear stacking game, and these gorgeous 14K gold huggies have easily become a staple in my everyday lineup,” says Sam Peters, senior fashion and luxury commerce editor. “The subtly checkered design offers a little extra flair beyond simple, classic gold styles yet is still quite versatile. These catch the light in the prettiest way and look beautiful paired with equally chunky hoops as well as other sculptural earrings.”The Timeless ChoiceAna Luisa Frida Pearl Huggie HoopsFew earring styles are as timeless as simple pearl drop hoops. This top-rated pair from Ana Luisa is plated in 14k gold and includes freshwater pearls. Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowWhy Trust ELLE Every product featured on ELLE.com is independently researched, tested, or editor-approved. We only recommend products that we stand behind, and the merchandise featured on our site is always driven by editorial and product testing standards, not by affiliate deals or advertising relationships. Any content created in partnership with advertisers is marked as such.Sarah Maberry is a commerce writer for Hearst Magazines, where she covers fashion, beauty and pop culture. A seasoned trend forecaster and fashion historian, she analyzes viral products and trends on a deeper level. When she’s not writing for Cosmopolitan, ELLE, Harper’s BAZAAR, House Beautiful, Town & Country, Delish and other publications, she can be found roaming the Museum at FIT (her alma matter) or sewing her own couture while she binge-watches reality TV.
html:
The Modern Statement Piece

Ana Luisa Pebble Pendant Necklace

“Among all the jewelry I have in my collection, there’s only a small handful of statement necklaces that go with everything, so I’m adding this ultra-chic, classic pendant to my cart,” says Dale Arden Chong, senior fashion commerce editor. “It’s beautiful on its own but would look great stacked with my daintier pieces as well. Need I say more?”

The Everyday Hoop

Ana Luisa Paris Twisted Hoop Earrings

“I’m a hoops girl and wear my earrings 24/7, so my everyday pair needs to be comfortable enough to sleep in and versatile enough to go with everything. These twisted huggies tick every box,” says Elly Leavitt, fashion and luxury editor. “Not only are they a great basic, but they haven’t yet tarnished even after I spent all summer swimming in them.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

The Ultra-Feminine Hoops

Ana Luisa Jessica Puffed Heart Hoops

These puffy, heart-shaped hoops are personally my most complimented pair of earrings. They’re lightweight for easy stacking yet also fun to sport alone. I love mixing and matching them with my other heart-shaped Ana Luisa pieces, too.

Mixed Metals Made Easy

Ana Luisa Asher Two-Tone Hoop Earrings

“Because I gravitate toward minimalist jewelry, I’ve been trying to experiment with mixing metals to zhuzh up pared-back fall outfits. Much to my delight, these hoops take all the guesswork out of this effort,” says Jaimie Potters, fashion and luxury senior commerce manager.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

The Easiest Gift Ever

Ana Luisa High Shine Layered Necklace Set

“Ana Luisa styles, like these layered necklaces, are perfect for everyday wear because they don’t tarnish—and since they’re on the affordable side, you won’t be afraid to really live in them,” says Jane Mafale, senior content strategy manager. “Their durability and versatility make them great for gifting, too.”

The Layered Hoop Look

Ana Luisa Toda Double Hoop Earrings

These layered hoops offer the look of multiple piercings with just one stud. Plus, they boast the perfect hint of sparkle.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

The Personality Piece

Ana Luisa Isla Heart Ring

“I’ve given Ana Luisa’s jewelry as a gift so many times,” says Heath Owens, senior commerce editor at Hearst. “It’s beautiful, affordable and water-resistant, and the designs are just trendy enough that you can find something to match your giftee’s personality, like these celestial hoops or this bubble heart ring.”

A Luxe Stacking Ring

Ana Luisa Gold Eternity Ring

This sparkly stacking ring may just be the most versatile piece in my growing collection of Ana Luisa jewelry. The extra thick, 14k gold plating and glittering cubic zirconia stones have held up incredibly well to regular wear and hand-washing. People are always amazed to learn how affordable this piece is despite how expensive it looks.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

A Tasteful 2-in-1

Ana Luisa Ash Double Hoop Earrings

Offered in gold, silver, and mixed metals, Ana Luisa’s Ash Double Hoops are truly the gift that keeps on giving (especially when the gift recipient is yourself). The secondary twisted hoop can be removed, allowing the sleek upper hoop to be worn independently.

The Do-It-All Bangle

Ana Luisa Brynley Gold Bangle Bracelet

Trust me, this humble gold bangle will get a whole lot of wrist time. I love mixing one or two in with my watches and chunky chain bracelets.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Stackable Sparkles

Ana Luisa Eden Huggies

“I’m always looking to elevate my ear stacking game, and these gorgeous 14K gold huggies have easily become a staple in my everyday lineup,” says Sam Peters, senior fashion and luxury commerce editor. “The subtly checkered design offers a little extra flair beyond simple, classic gold styles yet is still quite versatile. These catch the light in the prettiest way and look beautiful paired with equally chunky hoops as well as other sculptural earrings.”

The Timeless Choice

Ana Luisa Frida Pearl Huggie Hoops

Few earring styles are as timeless as simple pearl drop hoops. This top-rated pair from Ana Luisa is plated in 14k gold and includes freshwater pearls.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Why Trust ELLE

Every product featured on ELLE.com is independently researched, tested, or editor-approved. We only recommend products that we stand behind, and the merchandise featured on our site is always driven by editorial and product testing standards, not by affiliate deals or advertising relationships. Any content created in partnership with advertisers is marked as such.

Sarah Maberry is a commerce writer for Hearst Magazines, where she covers fashion, beauty and pop culture. A seasoned trend forecaster and fashion historian, she analyzes viral products and trends on a deeper level. When she’s not writing for Cosmopolitan, ELLE, Harper’s BAZAAR, House Beautiful, Town & Country, Delish and other publications, she can be found roaming the Museum at FIT (her alma matter) or sewing her own couture while she binge-watches reality TV.
